intro: Alysicarpus glumaceus subsp. glumaceus, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Its leaves are typically pinnately compound, with several pairs of leaflets. The fruit is a small, globose capsule that dehisces to release its seeds.
